subject: Philosophy
title: Modus Tollens
description: Learn Modus Tollens in one minute.

hook.text: If the dog barks, the burglar is here. The dog isn't barking. Therefore no burglar. That's modus tollens.

buildup.text: Modus tollens works backward: if P then Q; Q is false; therefore P is false.

discovery.text: It's how scientists disprove theories. If a prediction fails, the theory is wrong ‚Äî or incomplete.

twist.text: Karl Popper built his philosophy of science on this: good theories must be falsifiable via modus tollens.

climax.text: Denial of the consequent is one of the most powerful tools in human reasoning.

punchline.text: Sometimes the best way forward is to prove something wrong.

quiz.question: What is the structure of modus tollens?
options: If P then Q; not Q; therefore not P
If P then Q; P; therefore Q
If P then Q; not P; therefore not Q
